file_insights.scope: Added aria-label attributes to three IconButton components for improved accessibility

patterns_discovered.description: Adding aria-label attributes to icon-only buttons to provide screen reader context when title attribute alone is insufficient
locations: Expand/Collapse toggle button with conditional aria-label based on state

patterns_discovered.description: Using ternary operator to set aria-label dynamically based on component state (expanded/collapsed)
All action buttons now have both title and aria-label attributes for complete accessibility coverage
patterns_discovered.benefit: Supports both tooltip display and screen reader announcements

gotchas_discovered.description: Title attributes create browser tooltips but don't help screen readers; aria-label is necessary for proper accessibility compliance
gotchas_discovered.impact: Without aria-label, users relying on assistive technology may not understand button purposes

gotchas_discovered.description: Expand/collapse button label must update when state changes to accurately reflect current action
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Used conditional ternary operator to keep aria-label synchronized with component state

approach_outcome.strategy: Direct accessibility enhancement by adding ARIA labels to icon-only buttons
approach_outcome.implementation_quality: Clean and consistent implementation across all action buttons
approach_outcome.accessibility_improvement: Enhances WCAG compliance for screen reader users by providing semantic meaning to icon-only interface elements

recommendations.recommendation: Consider auditing other pages for similar icon-only buttons that may benefit from aria-label attributes
Include automated accessibility tests using tools like axe or jest-axe to catch missing aria-labels in future development
Document the pattern of combining title and aria-label attributes for icon buttons as a best practice in the codebase
recommendations.impact: Ensures consistency in future component development
